titleStmt.title: A proclamation, by the King and Queens Majesties. ... Whereas there have been several treasonable, and seditious designs and combinations, set on foot of late, in both our kingdoms, by persons enemies to the Protestant religion, and ill affected to our government ...
titleStmt.author: Scotland. Privy Council.

publicationStmt.publisher: Printed by the heir of Andrew Anderson, Printer to the King and Queens most excellent Majesties,

notesStmt.note: Dated: Given under Our Signet at Edinburgh, the nineteenth day of June. And of Our Reign, the second year, 1690.
Signed: Gilb. Eliot, Cls. Sti. Concilii.
Ordering a search in Edinburgh for the correspondents of Henry Navail [sic] Pain.
Reproduction of the original in the National Library of Scotland.
